title: Implement Domain Scoper for Context Optimization
description: Create a domain scoper that analyzes the codebase and determines which files are relevant for each domain. Uses static analysis, import graphs, and domain configuration to build a precise scope. Enables agents to load only what they need.

objective.i_want: precise domain scoping based on code analysis
objective.so_that: agents load exactly the files they need, not entire directories

acceptance_criteria.ears_format: WHEN domain scoper initialized THEN scope built from wave-config.json patterns
acceptance_criteria.test_approach: Initialize scoper, verify scope matches config patterns

acceptance_criteria.ears_format: WHEN file in scope has imports THEN imported files added to scope transitively
acceptance_criteria.test_approach: Scope file with imports, verify dependencies included

acceptance_criteria.ears_format: WHEN file imported by multiple domains THEN marked as shared
acceptance_criteria.test_approach: Create cross-domain import, verify shared marking

acceptance_criteria.ears_format: WHEN scope computed THEN cached until file changes detected
acceptance_criteria.test_approach: Compute scope twice, verify second is from cache

acceptance_criteria.ears_format: WHEN scope queried THEN files returned with relevance score 0-1
acceptance_criteria.test_approach: Query scope, verify scores present and ordered

acceptance_criteria.ears_format: WHEN file modified THEN affected scope entries invalidated

reuse_patterns.import_parsing: Use TypeScript compiler API or babel for import analysis
reuse_patterns.caching: LRU cache with file watcher invalidation

safety.rollback_plan: Use simple glob-based scoping from config

notes: Domain scoping is key to RLM efficiency. Use TypeScript compiler API for accurate import analysis. Consider using ts-morph for easier AST manipulation.
implementation_notes: 🟡 IN PROGRESS (40%): Domain-aware context loading partially implemented. Needs: complete domain scoping logic, load only relevant domain files, measure context size reduction. Files: Partial implementation in RLM layer
